Perhaps it would be a little stuffy in the summer but with a city centre hotel comes noise! Check-in very friendly and I liked the fact you needed your key to access each floor not just the rooms. I wouldn't pay much more than this as it is so basic but perfectly servicable. The shower was great. Very convenient for Tube and buses.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean hotel for the money, but not in the summer.”
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean, and location for sightseeing is excellent. The value is unbeatable for central london if you book in advance. There is no air conditioning in the rooms (just a tiny vent in the ceiling), so if it is a warm night you have choice of sleeping in a hot room or opening the window on to a very busy street and bus stop (even during the night) and suffering from noise and fumes. Other small issue is fact you can't tilt the LCD TV, so if you are on the bed you can hardly see what is on tv due to extreme viewing angle.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills But very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Travelcouple69_69
Reviews.Content: Stayed in travelodge tower bridge on the 18th of april with my gf as it was her birthday. Getting to the hotel was not a problem at all. Took the tube got out at tower hill tube station and from there it was hardly 6 mins walk. Easily got there as i had called earlier to know about the directions. Checking in at the reception was easy. They had launched these self checkin machines and we were helped out with this nice gentleman, Eastern european I assume. Have to say was very friendly and kept us laughing while helping us to check in. As we got our room key card we confirmed if it was on road side or railway side as we had already read the reviews about railway side being noisy. The person who was helping us getting checked in changed it to road side without any problem. Went to the room. Have to say the room had nothing more then just a bed but hey we paid 29 quid for the room as we managed to book in advance, and i think in central london getting a room for 29 quid is already good enough so we didn't really create a fuss on the room having basically just a bed and a table with tea making facility. Toilet was very clean, a bit small but techniqually we didn't have to play football in the toilet anyway. We didn't really eat in the cafe as we had other plans for the evening. Spent the whole night out in london. Have to say london closes really early for monday night. The bar we were in closes at 11 pm and we had to come back to the hotel dissappointed as we wanted to enjoy the whole night being my gf's birthday, a really special day for me also. To our amazement once we reached the hotel we found out that the bar in the hotel was open till 5 am. We spent almost the whole night sitting at the bar talking to the bar tender who made us feel like we were at home rather then somewhere out. He shared some of his experiences from his country ' Pakistan ' which me and my gf both were delighted to hear. IN all we had a terrific day in london. All cause of the friendly service I received in the hotel. Would stay here again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been a lot lot better”
Reviews.Author: BristolLondonbound Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Ok, i have stayed in some rubbish and dirty hotels and you get what you pay for, but for a Travellodge, and £100 a night, i expcted a little bit more than what we got. The bedding had blood stains on it, the sheets and the cover; the air-con (did it have any?) wasnt on and it was the hottest day on record in london in April since 1949. The heat was unbearable and had to sleep on top of the bed, but couldnt open the windows as the room was directly backing onto the train station! The breakfast was ok, but the service was awful, and they had the nerve to charge me £10 extra for arriving an hour early. I wont stay here again as this was a dire nights stay...i expected a LOT more from a Travelodge and they need to up it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent friendly efficient service and super value for money.”
Reviews.Author: JeffandLes
Reviews.Content: First class location and super value for money. Noise of trains was not too intrusive - more fascinating (did not carry on through teh nigth anyway). Plenty of bars and food establishments around and very handy for DLR, river trips and tube and of course the London Marathon. Room clean and warm enough. Asked for another pillow and it came. Only a couple minor of points: 1) Key card expired every night (we were staying 3 nights) so had to get it re-programmed when we returned each evening. 2) Shame about the lack of a left luggage facility - perhaps Travelodge could reconsider this provision. Jeff and Les

Reviews.Title: “Bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: pol2vega
Reviews.Content: Overall you get what you pay for, at least in London. T'was ideal for us as we weren't keen on spending time in the room lounging around. C'mon folks - A holiday is meant for traveling, not for staying in your hotel. To make it snappy, let's break it down: Location: Great stuff. T'was not in central London but at least it was next to Tower of London and a Tube station. Rooms: No frills. No cupboards or toiletries though there's a single bar of soap they won't bother changing whether you stay a day or 7 days. No Wi-Fi though you can pay 20 quid for a week for that. You could opt for that or go to any EAT or the nearby Minories pub for free WiFi. No mini fridge either. However, there's a TV, desk and a place to hang your clothes. Service: They actually forgot to clear our room one of the days that we stayed! Yup, we got back to a mess and had to ask for new towels from the reception. They duly obliged without an apology. Oh yes, one of the biggest turnoffs is the lack of a holding space for luggage, but that's a Travelodge policy so not much you can do about that, can you? Apart from that, there was this nice guy at the reception who was friendly - thanks mate!

Reviews.Title: “False economy!”
Reviews.Author: leitrim007
Reviews.Content: Ok this hotel is cheap - with good reason! It is incredibly basic. The room I stayed in was like a oven. and I couldn't sleep between the heat and the noise. My bathroom was not particularly clean, mould evident in the bath, no products provided at all - not even a bar of soap to wash your hands! I requested as extra towel as I was only provided with a tiny hand towel, I was then given another tiny hand towel. Staff are difficult to find and are not particularly helpful. The food is awful - honestly do not eat there - it is microwaved, rubbery and barely edible and the service is also terrible. The location is amazing but that is the only plus. I stayed there for work however I ended up having to eat elsewhere during my stay, the minories bar next door is lovely. I could not possibly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “cheap bit not very cheerful”
Reviews.Author: bexSunderland
Reviews.Content: Spent one night in this hotel for business purposes. The price was very good for central London and the location great for anyone wanting to sight see. However, that's were the positive ends – first the room. Very basic with cheap plastic seats, thin, grey towels and an uncomfortable bed. Then the restaurant – it was a bar really which again had the uncomfortable plastic seats and really was very basic. I didn't' have dinner but breakfast was well below other travel lodges I have stayed in – no vegetarian option, no beans or eggs and I ended up with a piece of toast and a cold tomato! Won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, value for money, exceptionally clean and suprisingly quiet”
Reviews.Author: rachelrose5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend visit to London. Did not expect much for the value price of under sixty pounds. We were amazed at how clean the room and hotel was and expected lots of noise from the nearby train and city noises, but it was really quiet and got a great nights sleep. Great location being a stones throw from Tower Bridge and the Bus stop round the corner with RV1 service takes you direct to Covent Garden. We had the buffet breakfast which is great value for money and the staff were very helpful and polite. Will use this hotel again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value London hotel - I'd book again”
Reviews.Author: Seagulldan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in February 2011, having taken advantage of the Travelodge sale. I picked the hotel for a budget couple of days away, and the price of the room was really good value. The hotel is in a good location, a couple of minutes walk from the Tower and St Katherines Dock., plus good tube & bus links to everywhere. Our room was on the ground floor, on the road side of the hotel. Initially, I was a bit concerned because the room window looked out directly onto the busy road and was right next to the pavement. But the soundproofing was really very good and we have no problems with noise from the road at all. The room was basic, but clean and pretty modern, and the bed was comfortable. There was a bit of noise from the corridor and from next door (telly blaring at 4am!), but nothing too major. The staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. We didn’t have breakfast in the hotel, as mentioned there are plenty of pubs & cafés around which serve decent food. The Goodman's Yard is a Wetherspoons pub just over the road and this does good value food if you're on a budget, and serves breakfast until noon. For a budget hotel in London, I was very happy with the Travelodge, I’ll definitely be booking again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Youngtravellor86
Reviews.Content: Great value hotel, a little walk from major attractions but Londons transport is amazing and there are train stations 30 seconds away. We arrived at 8am and thought we may just have to leave our bags at reception but to our suprise they gave us our keys and we were able to go in early at no extra charge. Great staff and very clean. Thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base , clean room , fab breakfast”
Reviews.Author: bigmanCardiff
Reviews.Content: Just outside the hotel is a pub which serves great food and great to go with teenagers , the hotel was very clean , the breakfast was great , location coudnt be better for exploring London , we had a lovely late night walk around St Catherines dock and Tower Bridge and will def go back :)

Reviews.Title: “OK, but don't expect too much !!”
Reviews.Author: lonesometravellerGB
Reviews.Content: Forget trying to obtain what you have booked and paid for: if the 'all-knowing Travelodge computer' (aka 'Know Nothing') doesn't show exactly what you booked - tough, the hotel won't honour it. After changing rooms, we eventually received something like my original booking - and a slip of paper with the direct line telephone ( try 0207702138, or +44207702138, if you are outside UK to speak to a human being). That was the good news, as was the up-grade of the hotel's 'double-glazing' which stops this having the "24-hour traffic noise in every room, from road (one side) or railway (other side)" which it had in the past - it IS quieter now. That was the only good news: the 'new' room was small, cramped but clean and generally adequate, and kept clean by the friendly Latvian room attendant. Don't expect privacy - see pictures of bathroom door !! Other than that, OK for a hotel within walking distance of the Tower of London, and bus stops to central London (RV1 - little red bus - for 'south of the river' attractions, ending up in Covent Garden - north of the river again. (Big Red) Bus 15 from outside the Tower will take you to St Paul's Cathedral, the Strand and theatreland, finishing in Trafalgar Square. Overall, it's OK, but definitely - no frills. Food? Don't know, I never eat Travelodge food anywhere that has any alternative within walking distance - and this one has lots, touristy and pricy near the Tower - but walk five to ten minutes EAST into the real London, and eat with the locals - hearty breakfasts for half the Travelodge prices, and twice their quality.

Reviews.Title: “one of the better travelodges”
Reviews.Author: janecad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights-11/12 Feb. Welcomed by reception and helped to do the self check-iin, easy peasy when you know how! Had a room on the 1st floor, looking out to yard and wall by the railway but no outside noise at all, just noise from inconsiderate people up and down til 4 am. All the staff we met were nice and friendly, Room clean and shower was fine. Borrowed hair dryer from reception, no charge. Breakfast a bit chaotic.,(EAT across the road but don't know if it opens at weekend) Lovely Indian Restaurant up the road. Tesco nearby. Restaurants by the river close very early at weekends. GBK closed at 7pm on saturday Would always be my first choice for a London stay-if the price was right!!

Reviews.Title: “Chip as chips!”
Reviews.Author: cazdat
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel just for leisure as we fancied a night out in London. We arrived and when i looked out of my room window i saw that we over looked train lines and a station, first thing i thought was 'oh great, this will be very noisy' although this hotel does warn on the web page that you may be disturbed by noise. In actual fact not one of us in our group heard one train! we didnt hear a single sound from outside. The room was clean, the bed was very comfortable. The staff were polite. It is close to the tube station (tower hill) so just a couple of minutes walking distance. when you walk in that direction you can see tower bridge which is walking distance too. There is a multi storey car park at the back of the hotel but i think it was 12 pounds for 12 hours. Depending on when you stay here you can get free parking! we got there on the Saturday and found that a back street very close to the hotel did not have parking restrictions at the weekend so we got free parking! Bonus! It cost about 68 pounds for the one night but hotels in more central areas were double the price so this was a cheap deal, the tube is about 6.40, they stop running around 12.30am but there are the night buses. Also it is only about 4 stops on the tube to embankment, change over and 2 more stops to leicester sqaure where the nightlife if fantastic! You will also find china town along here where we had a meal - the food was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Couple of small problems but overall pretty good.”
Reviews.Author: borgax
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a really good spot, close to river, Tower Hill and Tower Gateway, two Wetherspoons within a couple of minutes walk. The main problem was, although i was on the railway side the train noise wasn't annoying over the weekend, what was worse was the noise coming through the door as people walked past talking, the door didn't hold back much noise at all. In the end you just give up and start trying to hear what the different languages are!! Not really a problem for me but the Minories pub next door did have a late night on friday night, you couldn't hear the musicbut the bass came through the walls, this is only as i was right up that end of the hotel though. It was clean, the shower was good, although i prefer the bottom of the shower curtain to be not floating up and sticking to me! Staff sorted everything quickly. My stay was 4th-7th Feb' and even with the heater turned off the room was plenty warm for me. (it was working just turned off) As mentioned the Wetherspoons is good and close, they serve food till 10pm. We ate there instead of Travelodge for breakfast and food was quick and good, breakfast menu served till 12 noon. We only went to the Liberty Bounds pub which is really nice inside and has a view over to the Tower and Tower Bridge. But across the road there's a set of shops under ground level behind 'EAT' and in there's a KFC and also a pizza place where you can get an 11" pizza for £5 (3 toppings), it's freshly made and cheap and was fine. Also the hotel is a short walk from Liverpool Street Station, and a small tip if you're going to stock up on water rather then paying crazy prices for small bottles in small shops or at the Travelodge, where it'll cost you nearly that much for not even a litre, is to go to Tesco, there is one outside L.Street main exit onto Bishopsgate, or, there is another one near to Monument, where you can get 4 litres for £1.50 (2 x 2l bottles) So, overall a good stay, it was the weekend so was always going to be quieter than a weekday stay, such as trains didn't sound horns during weekend but they did monday morning. When i return to London again i would be happy to stay here again, but would ask about getting a room at the end of a corridor so there wouldn't be people passing all the time.

Reviews.Title: “would stay again, nice location, clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LuciePop
Reviews.Content: We booked two nights on the travelodge sale a while back so only paid £24 for 2 nights. On arrival at tower hill tube station we struggled to find the hotel ( after 9pm) but it is very easy once you have done it once or twice. Great location though! the hotel itself is very clean and seemed like it was either a newer hotel or had a refurb ( or maybe im used to worse travelodges ha) Our room was on the 4th floor right over the railway. Noise- To be fair the windows do a fab job, the trains passing sound ( all day/night) reminded us of a kettle boiling sort of sound ( so not too bad) but if you dont fall straight to sleep after a day sightseeing around then il be suprised. If we stayed again we would ask for a room not facing the railway. the room- was clean and the bathroom much nicer than other travelodges. we had to ask for extra towel as they had only given us one. and the pillow are as flat as pancakes but staff are more than happy to provide more. The flatscreen tv on the walls and lighting in the room is good. Heating is great, warmed up the room pretty quick. Only complaint is there are only two sockets by the desk and the mirror is the other side of the room so a problem for us girls wanting to straighten/dry hair Hairdryers as available for 2 hour rent (?!) the housekeeping woke us up about 8.30 on the saturday by tapping on most doors on the floor (without the sign i presume) and shouting housekeeping. unavoidable though i suppose! the staff , from what we spoke to , were friendly enough! we would definately stay at this hotel when we return to london. =D

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Slenny
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really well located, just 2 minutes from the Tower of London and a similar distance from Tower Hill tube. The hotel is a converted office building and whilst the interior is relatively modern and functional it looks a bit clinical and impersonal for my liking, but then you cant expect too much considering the price. The rooms are spacious and clean and there is a good size desk area which you dont often find in Travelodge's. Breakfast was reasonably basic but again for the price you cant expect too much. Overall the hotel is an ideal base for a 1 or 2 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, perfect all round”
Reviews.Author: Bmthlad35
Reviews.Content: Brilliant base hotel, handy for tower hill tube and tower gateway dlr. Rooms nice and clean with ample towels. Needed extra pillow and reception were very helpful and got me one straight away. Heater and tv worked fine. I was a bit concerned with other reviews on here but my stay was comfortable and excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Awful awful hotel! Do not waste your money!”
Reviews.Author: kttravelbunny
Reviews.Content: Absolutely awful. This was a business trip which was paid for through my employer. If this had been my money, I would have demanded a refund and moved to a different hotel. I stayed for 2 nights with work colleagues. Each of us had a different problem with our rooms (no toilet paper, no pillow cases on the beds, stains on the bedding). The staff are generally rude and unhelpful. Breakfast is basic and just about edible. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great position, better than average Travelodge.”
Reviews.Author: Loz97
Reviews.Content: This was very much a distress purchase as were stuck at Heathrow during the ‘snow crisis’. However we were very pleased with the facilities offered during our two night stay. We arrived at midnight after a nightmare day; the room was as warm as toast and the bar still open. Room quite acceptable with a spotlessly clean bathroom; we just had to ask for tea making supplies which were cheerfully supplied. The room was at the back, but we heard no railway noise at all, it was only later we discovered the viaduct actually had a frequent train service. This would be a great spot for tourists, just round the corner from Tower Gateway (Docklands Railway) and Tower Hill (Underground) stations, and just a little further to the Tower and Tower Bridge. We didn’t try the breakfast, as we have previously been disappointed with Travelodge offerings. The Wetherspoons round the corner did super freshly cooked offerings at bargain prices. The Tesco Express provided supplies for the journey home (yes, our holiday was eventually cancelled!).

Reviews.Title: “Overall worth the money”
Reviews.Author: DundeeDaytripper
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights and found the place easily when I came off the Tube as it's literally a 2 minute walk from Tower Hill Tube Station and even less from Tower Gateway (on the Docklands Light Railway). The location is therefore fantastic - just round the corner from the Tower of London and Tower Bridge, thus I rated this "excellent" for location. The Tube is cheap and cheerful and, even if you get lost, it's easy to get off at the next station to backtrack or simply ask any of the helpful staff in the Underground. The staff at the hotel are friendly and helpful and always have a ready smile so I was happy to rate them "very good". Cleanliness in the hotel generally I also rated "very good" - same in the room - though my bin in the bathroom wasn't emptied on my second day. The bedding was changed daily and ample fresh towels replenished, also on a daily basis. The room is basic but adequate for a short stay. As with all Travelodges, there are tea and coffee making facilities though it has to be said they are a bit stingy with the teabags (only one provided in a room catering for two people). To be fair, though, I may have been given more had I requested this. The reasons I gave the room an overall "poor" rating was for the following reasons: 1) lack of drawers! There were none at all in my room even though there was plenty space for them. I therefore had to put my smalls, t shirts etc onto a shelf above the coathangers, which is intended for towels and the spare pillow. The towels therefore had to be moved into the bathroom and the pillow I put on my bed. I'm only 5ft 3" so it was a bit of a pain to reach up to rifle through the things I needed on the shelf. 2) shortage of coathangers - only 6 provided. This was just enough for me on my own but no good at all for a couple. 3) My chair seat wasn't bolted down to the legs on the left hand side so any movement to the right meant you were likely to fall off - quite dangerous for people who are maybe not as quick to save themselves as I was! 4) Lack of power sockets. There was only two in my room - located at the desk under the window. Not very handy when you need to put on your laptop and charge a phone, camera and mp3 player - all while heating up the kettle to make a cup of tea while trying to dry your hair with a hairdryer - so things had to be disconnected constantly at the risk of forgetting to plug them in again to recharge. 4) I was on the ground floor (room 12) which faces a main road. Unless you pull down the window blind (no curtain) everyone can see into your room. I was never awoken by traffic noise however. The bed was a double - lovely soft clean duvet with a comforable mattress giving me a good night's sleep every night meaning it earned an "excellent" rating. I chose not to book breakfast at this hotel having had many Travelodge breakfasts over the years in various hotels around the country. I feel they are not worth the money charged and, passing through the breakfast area one morning, spotted that they are still serving the same tired old dried out breakfasts they normally serve, so was glad I didn't have any. Instead I tried the pub literally steps away from the hotel at the front door. The Minories is a very spacious pub but manages to retain a cosy feel due its fairly low arched/brick ceiling and is located right underneath the railway line so the trains travelling overhead can be a bit noisy. The food and service however is fantastic (breakfast for £5.99 including a drink). I booked my room a good few weeks in advance of travel through one of Travelodge's own promotional emails. Had I not got the room for £35 a night via this special offer, I would have paid around £85 a night for the room. Overall I rate this hotel "very good"

Reviews.Title: “Average Travelodge in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ChrisCymru
Reviews.Content: A decent basic hotel that does the job. As advised is next to a train line and the noise from that seems to be worse the higher you are. In need of a bit of a freshen up but communal areas are nice and the staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “very basic hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: torchello
Reviews.Content: Yes the room was VERY small, the windows didn`t open fully, the bed was far too soft and only one lift was working BUT the room was extremely clean, well serviced,and we had booked during a " Travelodge sale" so got a terrific deal .Our room was on the fourth floor- road side- and noise was not an issue. If you want more towels etc just ask - all the staff we saw were working hard and were very responsive. We had breakfast in the Wetherspoons pub - easily done as just across the road . The location is great - we used the number 15 bus quite a bit but also walked along the river to Tate Modern etc. Overall we would recommend this hotel as a basic ,cheap, base in a great location - we certainly intend to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast was very disapointing.”
Reviews.Author: dessislava
Reviews.Content: I have stayed twice now in this hotel, this time my only complaint was the breakfast. The room was clean, some stains on the bedding but no big deal. The breakfast was very dissapointing-there was no tomatoes, scrambled eggs and very few choices of cereals. Croissants were rock hard, I could not believe that somebody can offer something like that to us. The lady came with some more croissants, so I went to have some, only to discover that they were the same- rock hard. I could not be bothered to question staff as the girl looked fed up, she could not bear to smile. I will stay again at Travelodge but not in this particular hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dollery8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights for £55 per night. Very good transport links. Tower hill tube is about 3 minute walk away, takes about 10 mins to central london.We also went to the O2 and the DLR station is almost next to the hotel took about 15 mins. Rooms very small but very clean. we were on the road side on the 3rd floor.the windows have triple glazing so didn't hear a thing all night and slept really well (mind you the drink helped us sleep!) I should think it's a bit more noisy on the train side but not sure. The only thing i would say is that the beds were very soft and bouncy i ended up sleeping on the sofa. All in all if you can get a good price it's great for central london.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, very quiet, but very expensive.”
Reviews.Author: arttochoke
Reviews.Content: Great room, very basic as expected, but very clean. Bed was too bouncy and kept me awake the first night, way too soft for two people, you bounce each other out of bed! Staff were friendly and there were no issues. I would stay there again if I had too, but the bed kind of puts me off.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and great Location”
Reviews.Author: Shaedrah
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in November, very comfortable room, clean and tidy. Shower was nice and hot in the morning, and towels left where exchanged. Staff where polite, friendly and helpful. Location was amazing, from the Tower Hill Tube station, you just need to head round the corner and under the tracks past the blue station which sits pretty much on the opposite side of the tracks as the hotel. No room service, but wasn't expecting any, but you where fine to take food to your rooms if you wish. Overall for the price an excellent stay and a place we would happily stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “good cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: nevnmand
Reviews.Content: stayed for 2 nights slept well both nights despite overlooking railway line, room was clean and big enough, flat screen t.v., tea and coffee supplied what more could you want from a budget hotel in an ideal location, will use again.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: BathBabe
Reviews.Content: Location: 5 minute walk from Tower Hill tube station, Tower Bridge and London Tower. Great for exploring, Worth the 15 minute walk to Brick Lane for a curry too, if you have never been there it is a real(ish) London experience with some authentic food - but you have to hunt for it through a 'gauntlet' of offers. Pub next door was great on Friday night, not so good on Saturday night when they wouldn't let us in (we weren't goth enough). Weatherspoons across the road though. Tesco express very close and a newsagent too. The room was clean and comfortable, bed was very comfy and the sheets were crisp and clean. The towels were clean but well used (quite rough) but this is a Travelodge so don't expect luxury thread counts. Flat screen TV was great for watching the news while partner was in the shower. The room does get very hot (even in November), this was quickly rectified by opening a window during the day and closing it at night. We were in a front room, overlooking offices and a busy road, the double internal and external glazing made sure that noise was not an issue. The staff were friendly but bear in mind that Travelodge do not pay their staff well, English was not their first language but communication really was not a problem. Please do us all a favour, don't shout at the staff and speak really slowly like they are stupid, there was one very intoxicated American bloke Friday night that did this, it just make you look stupid. We had breakfast there once, it was OK but you will get a much better deal in either of the pubs mentioned above. It was a great price, for a great location and we had a fantastic time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: SparkleMC
Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly staff but most important a fantastic location for exploring London. 2 min walk from Tower Hill tube station, Tower of London and of course Tower Bridge!

Reviews.Title: “I recommend it”
Reviews.Author: Janet21LL
Reviews.Content: It's in an ideal spot for the Thames. A short walk to the Tower and bridge. The hotel is nice but basic. One thing I found awkward was a lack of space to put my clothes away. There is a small area to hang a few clothes but no drawers. so mainly I kept my clothes in my case which was easy to cope with but if you were taking evening wear with you,maybe that would be a bit more awkward. the hotel is clean and the staff polite and helpful. We didn't have any meals there. We had breakfast at a Wetherspoons not far away and there are plenty of places to eat. it's a short walk to Tower Hill tube station. I would definately stay in a Travel Lodge hotel again. But maybe in a different part of London to be nearer to other attractions. But ideal for the Thames. I did see reviews that people were bothered by trains as Fenchurch St station is nearby but I hardly noticed them and it didn't bother my stay at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Area for London Trip .. Lovely hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Tinkerbel
Reviews.Content: I booked this room as it was one of the cheapest I could find in London (Premier Inn was nearly double the price) and chose Tower bridge branch as it had the best reviews on here. I was very happy with the location, a 2 minute walk to Tower Bridge and the Tower of London. Lots of little local shops and pubs and restaurants around about it and a selection of places to eat. The room was small however adequate for sleeping and relaxing as we were out most of the time doing things during the day. The room was very clean and tidy as was everywhere else in the hotel. Staff were very friendly and happy to help whenever you needed anything or advise of where to go. Some negative comments I read on here was about the noise of the railway station which is right next to it, however I had a room which was next to the station and the noise was minimal, infact I would say you would have to be listening for the trains to hear them. Some tips, 1. Take a hairdryer with you as if you borrow one from reception you can only have it for 2 hours. 2. Dont pay for the breakfast, its not great and there is a Wetherspoons on the corner which you could probably get a better breakfast from. 3. The room can get very stuffy and hot, open the window for ventilation. Overall I would recommend this room and would stay here myself again !

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what it says it is”
Reviews.Author: bgoldfish85
Reviews.Content: When booking, I was clearly informed this hotel may experience some railway noise due to being next to a railway. Despite this warning, and with a room on that side of the hotel - I had an excellent nights sleep! The hotel was a little hard to find at first -but this was mainly due to road works and construction around the site. The location is great - not far from the tube or DLR - and very close to Tower Bridge. The room was very clean and spacious. I had windows overlooking the railway lines and the DLR station and the temperature of the room was fine. Lots of different lighting choices if you flick a few switches, and a television with a variety of channels. The bathroom was clean and the shower was hot and powerful. No free toiletries - but this is as advertised! No problems with bedding or towels. No complaints!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: allison2010
Reviews.Content: stayed at hotel for 2 nights, past reviews mentioned noise from railway, room was facing office's and we heard nothing from the railway. room was perfect, tea and coffee available and clean towels daily, room was new and fresh and staff were delightful. food was not that great, that's why only ate once, waited a while and lasagne was very (microwaved) ate across the road at witherspoons, who do a huge breakfast for £5. will be back next year and decided to stay again due to the 2mins walk to tower bridge station. 1st time on london underground omg, total shock. we will be ready for the race next year, glasgow is so relaxed.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Clean”
Reviews.Author: PatDexter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travelodge Tower Bridge for a week. I had misunderstood the search menu and, wanting twin beds, ended up in a handicapped room. I hope we didn't displace any handicapped people but the room did have twin beds. Conveniently located a five minute walk from the Tower Hill Underground Station, we found it simple to get about town. The room was large to accomodate wheelchairs. With few amenities, the room did have a kettle for heating water, air conditioning, and quiet location (on the side of the building away from the train noises.) We chose not to buy the offered breakfast but ate either at the Minories Pub next door, at the Weatherspoons across the street, or from the grocery store located nearby in St. Katherine's Dock. All of those options were less expensive than the offered breakfast at the hotel, which looked just ok. One thing I would mention is that we found few restaurants in the area open in the evening. Most of them served lunches to busineses and closed late afternoon. So if you don't want to eat at the pub next door, you might want to plan to eat away from the hotel at dinner time. One other thing future guests may want to know is that the Travelodge really has nothing to do with the internet you pay for when you register. It is offered by an offsite company and the staff at the Travelodge is largely uninformed as to its use. The way it works is not intuitive, at least it wasn't to me. When you make your reservation and pay for internet, you sign up for a My Travelodge account. A voucher code is sent to that account and you use the voucher code every time you sign onto the internet. The only other two complaints we had were that the toilet paper wasn't refilled even when the roll was completely empty until we requested more paper and that there was only enough hot water to take a tepid shower. These weren't major things and were offset by the price of the room (Our room averaged 60 BPS a day) and the convenient location. We were satisfied with the accomodation and wouldn't hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Muzajz
Reviews.Content: The trick with this Travelodge is to get a room on the road side, not on the side of the train tracks where it's a lot noisier. My room, on the 5th floor on the road side, was absolutely fine - very clean, mostly new, relatively quiet for a central London location. Of course you (don't) get what you pay for - towels had obviously lived a long life, no shampoo/shower gel or anything like that. But still, more than acceptable and great value compared to other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant except for the hot rooms.”
Reviews.Author: batman9963
Reviews.Content: we have just returned today from our stay with my sister and husband from usa. the staff are wonderful and rooms good -but had to ask for a fan-as so hot. across the road from a weatherspoons and a pub next door and buses to covent garden just under the bridge. tower 3 mins walk away and underground too. paid for early book in but had to wait 15 mins as not quite cleaned. we had rooms for £29 first night and £45 the next night . would come back. we were so lucky as it was the mayors river festival and night carnival and fireworks on the thames was great. my relatives from usa said that they would return but dont expect it to be cool in the rooms. trains rstop after 12pm and start again at 6am so with triple glazing we were ok on train side and ask for that if you dont want road sidewhich is noisy all night. i recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, hot, very poor value for money! AVOID!”
Reviews.Author: alvy1179
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a four lane ring road one side and the overland railway line the other, it was so noisy. There was no black out curtains, and no AC so you either over heat in the small, airless, stuffy room, or have no sleep due to the CONSTANT traffic and rail noise. This hotel felt like it was by the side of the M1, not in London. This hotel is the worst I have stayed in London. (We stay in London frequently). It cost over £100.00 and was lousy. We were staying two nights but left the following night and went and stayed at another hotel, just around the corner, for £30.00 more, 5 Star and LOVELY. My advise shop around and avoid this hotel at all cost and spend the extra £30-£40 on a decent stay and a good nights sleep. This hotel should cost £49.99 a night, pay anymore and you are being ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Don't open the windows!”
Reviews.Author: MikeWReading
Reviews.Content: Previous reviews have already said it. Travelodge's Mr. Sleep can't have been here. It's hot and you dare not open the windows because the screeching trains pass right by on one side and there is an equally noisy road on the other. With the windows closed it's not too bad, they are at least reasonably sound proofed. And if you can get it for £12, and if it's not during a heatwave, then it's a good deal for a hotel located just five minutes walk from Tower Bridge. Only one bath towel and no cups or the usual tiny soap bar were in evidence when I checked in around 10 p.m.. Couldn't be bothered to complain as I'd brought my own soap anyway, and it was a long way down to reception (Travelodge rooms don't have such luxuries as phones and there is no room service anyway). Toilet not properly cleaned and part of the shower tap was missing but I'm used to that from other Travelodges. Don't stay here in summer, and only if you can get the advance booking rate of less than £30. I got it for £12. Otherwise there must be a better alternative!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value, clean room and a great nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: MrsHutchy06
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel in advance and obtained the £29 per night rate. Having read the previous comments I was concerned about the noise and heat so I called 3 weeks before arrival and requested a ground floor room, this was no problem. On arrival the room was ready, we were however a towel short, but after a quick visit to reception, 5 mins later a second towel was delivered. The room was clean and everything was in order, the view was not spectacular (the retaining wall of the DLR) but we didnt go there for the view!. We stayed for 5 nights as we were on an extended weekend break, for the duration of the stay we were not woken with train/road noises or vibrations. The location is fantastic, 5 mins walk to tower hill, or a 10 min walk to Tower Bridge and the Thames path to central london. We decided to not eat in the restuarant, mainly due to the price - £7.50 per breakfast, instead we opted for the weatherspoons a 2 min walk away. We also eat at the Miniories pub on one of the evenings - good reasonably priced food. When we visit London next, we will definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Cheap Basic Hotel between Busy Road and Railway Line”
Reviews.Author: knutsford1
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is Clean and BAsic and for the price it is good value. It is also in a very good area generally. However.....It is postioning between one of the busiest roads in London and a busy railway stations. This means if you have a room on either side of the hotel, the noise can be unbearable. You may think well, just keep the window closed so you can't hear the noise. Well unfortunately, there is no air con so if you are there in the hotter summer months, you have no choice. The room was basic but fine, clean. but personally, I would never stay here again becasue I couldn't get more than 4 hrs sleep even with ear plugs. The Travelodge at Liverpool Street is fat batter and only about a mile away.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, basic room”
Reviews.Author: tick_tock_tick_tock
Reviews.Content: This travelodge is great for a cheap night or two in London, especially if you can prebook at a reduced rate like we did. The check in process was fast and efficient, and the room was very small and basic (as per the Travelodge ethos) but it was clean. Things to note: the mattress was very soft and bouncy - we slept well, but there is some noise from the nearby trainline so if you're a light sleeper you'll want to stay elsewhere. Remember to take your own toiletries (and hairdryer). Towels, tea/coffee facilities and a TV are provided. Be prepared to walk lots if the tube is out of action - it took us around an hour to walk to Leicester Square and we walk pretty quickly! Good, cheap breakfast can be had in the nearby Wetherspoons pub which seems to be surprisingly well run.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: playgal8
Reviews.Content: this is a great hotel in quite a quiet area of london its great for the price i paid which was very cheap theres not much to do around there in the night but theres a weatherspoons accross the road if you fancied a few drink i didnt have breaksfast i went to weatherspoons accross the road and paid £1.50 for a bacon buttie and cup of coffee i thought this was ok for me as im not a big morning eater.. i did have jacket potato things at the hotel in the night which were fine.. id defintetly stay here again its quite quiet and a good base for the tubes and buses to get around id probably pay more to stay here than what i did also.if u get a good deal book it id definetly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Clean basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trisia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and basic. The room is basic, with no aircondition and no telephone facilities. so I believe it will not be that comfortable in summer. it does have a heather though so for winter it is fine. the breakfast was really good and the hotel really central. There is Aldgate tube and Tower hill tube really close, but I think if you plan to travel at this location you should also take note of the busses that pass from there as there were quite a lot of busses and a bus therminus near Aldgate. for example bus number 25 takes you directly to totenham court road (near the theatre where we will rock you is shown). and the busses stop right beside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: brindley88
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights after a horrendous stay at the covent garden travel lodge. Stayed here a few times now and cant fault the place. Staff and hotel are excellent. Cant believe the covent garden hotel and this one are run by the same company. Tip: If you travelled by car, leave your car in the Minories car park overnight for £2 then before breakfast take your car over to the opposite side of the road to the car park there, where you can leave your car for £10 7am to 7pm then at 7pm put the car back in minories for the cheap £2 overnight stay. It sounds a bit of a hassle but is no problem really. Hotel is in a great location. Weatherspoons over the road is really handy too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value For Money, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Cocktails_In_The_Sun
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Travelodge Tower Bridge for 3 days in Feb 2010. Ideal Location as 5 min walk from the Tower Hill station, so easy access straight into London. Also Bus stop right outside hotel for alternative travel into London. Great pub a 2 min walk away called Minnories. Excellent food - fantastic value for money. The Travelodge is basic, but clean and tidy. Double Bed, spacious room for clothes, dressing table and bathroom with a bath and shower. Only thing I would say is that it isn't signed very well when you come out of Tower Hill station! But once you know where it is, you can't miss it! Would definatly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good area”
Reviews.Author: traveller489
Reviews.Content: Excellent budget stay for 3 nights. Just round the corner from Tower Hill Station so no problem getting into central London. Theres a Wetherspoons accross the street and a pub right next to the hotel, Minories which was excellent for breakfast. Would definately stay here again, although room was a bit noisy if we opened the window which looked onto the street.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money”
Reviews.Author: ambieoo7
Reviews.Content: never used a travel lodge before as always used the hiltons. this trip there was 3 of us and the hilton will not do a triple room at the docklands, so we went for the travel lodge tower bridge. We paid 39.00 for the room unlike 100+ for the hilton and now im converted!! Now what we got for the 39.00 was a double bed and a sofa bed which the sofa bed can be used as two singles, we all found comfy, the bathroom had a shower and no bath, but was clean and plenty of towel and bedding in the room. There is a pub next door which was fantastic value for london, we opted to go in the morning for breakfast rather than paying 7.50 at the hotel, we paid 4.99 for a fantastic breakfast with a drink at pub. overall it was a great hotel for a one night stay at london and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Condition, Basic Service, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: St3f
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 5 nights. It was really modern and clean. It was a two minute walk to the Tower Hill tube station. Very basic room, there was no telephone in the room, the bathroom was ok, spacious enough for 2. When we checked in, the receptionist, though quite polite, didn't know much about the rooms. There was no free wifi spot, I had to pay 25p for a week for internet if I remember correctly. The cleaning lady insisted on leaving only one pair of towels, so I had to leave a note for her to leave 2. We ate at the restaurant only once. We ordered a pizza and it wasn't eatable. I would stay there again and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “It is worth to stay!”
Reviews.Author: wingwing23
Reviews.Content: Clean room and toliet. good location. The bed is comfortable. i would like to complain that there is no free wifi, really noisy coz the rail is busy. Also, you can't drop your baggage before check in and after checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there in the hot weather!”
Reviews.Author: MrLlanmartin
Reviews.Content: Guest rooms have no air conditioning and you have to have the window in the room open during the hot weather as the hotel is very warm naturally. Only problem the window being open is that all rooms eitther look out over the London Ring Road which is very busy from around 5am in the morning to 1am / 2am at night, or they face the Dockland Light Railway. Public rooms on the ground floor are air conditioned nut not very comforable, the vast majority of seating being dining chairs. Smal, reasonably priced menu in restaurant, but still things were not available. Would suggest eating diagonally right across the road from the hotel, in the JD Wetherspoons pub on bend of ring road. One big plus, if you are travelling by car. Overnight parking is very cheap for London in the Minories City of London Car Park at rear of hotel (other side of Light Railway. Only £4 7pm - 7am and only £2 an hour after 7am.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but room like an oven”
Reviews.Author: gw231
Reviews.Content: We were lucky and got a room on the 5th (top) floor where luckily the window restrictors had been broken and the windows opened wide but you have to shut them at night as its noisey on the main road and the room was so hot it made sleep difficult. The room was OK although nobody made the room up for our second nights stay (they didn't make the bed or even come in the room). It's an excellant location so near the tower of London and Tower Bridge with a Whethersppons pub opposite and next to the Minories pub (both really good and good value food.) Brealfast in the travelodge OK but they kept running out of things all the time. Both pubs do breakfast. I've been in travelodges before where they have provided fans so this one take note- until you do I wouldn't go there in the summer again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful nights sleep, bad service, but clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: HLF89
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, we thought the location of it was good (near the centre and close to an underground and train station) but when we got in our room, it was about 4 meters from the railway lines. We also had no soap in our room so we went to ask for some at reception and they said they had ran out. Our friends room was on the opposite side of the corridor and she had a good nights sleep and only heard a few cars go past, but us on the other hand had a terrible nights sleep as trains were going past all night. We were very close so they were extremely loud even with the window shut. Also the room was so hot and stuffy and we couldnt do anything about it due to the noise. Even though we had these issues, the room was nice and clean and just what we needed for our stay, but i would have prefered to not be woken up every hour and for the services to be better.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if it's warm and busy... and you want any service!”
Reviews.Author: sastrantia
Reviews.Content: It is in a great loaction...but...! The room was clean, but the light switch was broken - very dodgy. When we returned late in the evening we couldn't get into our corridoor and so after several very annoying trips up and down in the lift and persuading the staff it was important enough to draw them away from the tv they were watching, they eventually opened it from the inside and propped it open with a piece of cardboard, meaning anyone could walk in off the street. We stayed on the fifth floor which was unbearably hot. You are then faced with the choice of having the windows shut and being SO hot there was absolutely no chance of sleep... or having the window open so the sound of the trains outside was even louder... every 15 minutes - and there was absolutely NO chance of sleep there either! If none of that prevented you from sleeping the incredibly creaky floorboards will! The shower was no more than a dribble. There was one towel between the two of us. Breakfast...well...there was nowhere to sit to eat in the first place, then no bowls, no spoons, no croissants, no muffins, no egg or bacon out, no nutella and the orange juice was off. I stay at Travelodges all the time, but this has to be the worst of the lot. Great location and cheap, but was it worth it? I'd say not...

Reviews.Title: “Great Locatgion”
Reviews.Author: Brady34
Reviews.Content: My Partner and i decided to go to London for my birthday. We decided to stay at the Travelodge at London Bridge due to the location. It has great rail links and a short walk to the Tower of London and London Bridge. Check in was very quick and the staff were lovely. The room was clean and just what we wanted. Slight noise due to the traffic - but we were in London - what do you expect! We decided to just have room only as it would have been £7.50 each and we found a really great pub down the road under the bridge that did a full English breakfast and tea/coffee for just £4.99. Just what you need for a long day walking for London. We plan to return later in the year and will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, modern, clean”
Reviews.Author: stevegos
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights on business. This is a newer style Travelodge. Very basic room only hotel that is clean and modern but no-thrills Room is small with only a roller blind for a curtain at the window. No air conditioning and as it one of the hottest weeks of the year, the rooms are very hot with little ventilation. Bathroom is very small with shower. No complimentary toiletries. Room has a small desk and hanging area for about 8 items of clothing. Hotel is on a very busy and noisy road junction,so if you a light sleeper, think again! The hotel is also right next to the DLR (railway) plus bus stops nearby. The hotel has breakfast available for a £6.50 extra and there is also a bar and snack available. but there are also plenty of bars and pubs nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Don't hesitate to book if you see it at a good price...”
Reviews.Author: PlymouthGirl
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for 4 nights, like alot of travelodges it has pros and cons but we thought it was very good value at around £50 ish pounds a night for zone 1 in London. The only downside was the train noise but to be honest when we shut the windows we could barely hear it. We didn't bother with breakfast as there is a couple of Wetherspoons nearby who do a massive breakfast for £4 all cooked to order. The location is great and walked all the way down to the London Eye and back on our first day via the Thames walk.

Reviews.Title: “BEST BARGAIN FIND IN LONDON WITH CHILDREN”
Reviews.Author: SwanseaLewis
Reviews.Content: I travelled with a my grandson aged 9 and a friend and her grandson used the £19-£29 deal per night Travelodge offer. Stayed for 2 nights with breakfast (free for the children) for £57.00. The staff were helpful, the room was clean and large. There is no fuss with wardrobes etc. Free tea, coffee and TV mounted on the wall, The breakfast was good and plenty of choice. Tower of London only 5 minutes away and walked along the Thames to London Eye about 30 minutes (lots to see and do on way). Had a meal in the Minories pub which was excellent value. The hotel was incredible quiet, this is due to the triple glazing that has been installed and works. Only downside is if you arrived early they charge £10 per room to leave your cases, but as we had booked 2 rooms we put all the cases in there for the £10

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel except when its warm!”
Reviews.Author: Rich&Vicks
Reviews.Content: Staying for the second time at this hotel with Hubby. First time we stayed was in February 2009, couldnt fault the hotel -great location, rooms a reasonable size for London, basic as you would expect from a Travelodge but clean and tidy. Therefore, when we looked to book again we didnt hesitate to choose this as our hotel. Booked a 3 night stay over this last weekend a 25th - 27th June. The hotel was just as we remembered but the rooms have no air conditioning or fans and the window only opens a matter of inches. The first 2 nights werent too bad but last night the heat was almost unbearable and neither hubby or I managed to get any sleep until almost 3am when it seemed to cool a little. During the our previous stay in February this obviously wasnt an issue for us and we never gave it a thought but there is no way I would stay at this hotel again in the summer months. For a modern, reasonably new hotel this is a great let down.

Reviews.Title: “Some pluses, mainly minuses.”
Reviews.Author: Rides_And_Free_Beer
Reviews.Content: PLUSES: -Reasonably priced for a mid-week stay. -Room very clean and okay sized for a London hotel - Staff polite - Shower nice and hot and powerful MINUSES: - Room very, very basicly appointed - only 3 (skinny) towels, 3 pillows, 1 bar of soap. - Shower was tiny and no lock on bathroom door - Considering this is a "place to lay your head" kinda place, the bed being the most important part, the bed was horrible! - a real "roll together-fest"! - Room was quiet from inside the hotel, but noisy outside from train-track. If I'd paid £40-50 for this room, I would have been very happy. But for £85.00, I would expect from my experience of London hotel, to at least have a better mattress, some shower gel, and double-glazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not the best Travelodge in London”
Reviews.Author: ScratchyBadger
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a single night. Having stayed at other Travelodge hotels in London, this one did not compare that well as the room was in need of maintenance - broken plug sockets, broken window latches, broken shower controls, broken bedside lights and a damaged blind were the main issues. The water pressure in the shower was also disappointing. The hotel is well located for the city business district and is conveniently situated 3 mins walk from Tower Hill tube station. A Tesco Express supermarket, a Starbucks and many retaurants and pubs were all close by too. The staff were very friendly and polite - the best I had seen from a Travelodge. Breakfast was well stocked and maintained - though get there early to get the best choice. This Travelodge does not compare well to the nearby City Road nor the Farringdon Travelodges and the best in London is at Euston which is head and shoulders above them all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: ijw54
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at this hotel. Good location, only 15 mins on Circle line from St Pancras. The view of the Tower of London is amazing as you leave/enter the tube station. Hotel is no more than 5 mins walk from station. The room is basic, but clean,and you don't go to London to spend all day in your room. Beds were comfortable, there's a flat screen tv that I only used for early morning news whilst getting ready. We stayed on the 5th floor overlooking the road, but room was not noisy. Breakfast was good value, with an assortment of juices, cereals, croissants and buns, usual English, toast, jams and honey,tea and coffee, and my grandson ate free. Staff pleasant and friendly, I was amazed when one of the receptionists recognised me from a previous stay (I stayed last May and October). Location is great, you can walk down to the Tower, along the Thames, St Katherine's Dock and HMS Belfast close by. Travel connections good.Incredible value for money at £30 a night, and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel great travellers should stop moaning”
Reviews.Author: casseycc
Reviews.Content: Really dont know what some people moan about. The hotel was in a fantastic location for everything, 3 mins from Tower Hill tube the room was spotless the staff were polite. We arrived down for breakfast at 9.40 and there was plenty choice. It said on the hotel site there would be not shower gel etc so buy travel size packs whats the problem. Our room was next to the road and I was a bit apprehensive as I had read reviews about the noise but we didn't hear it and it certainly didn't keep us awake and you are staying in the centre of London after all, we live in a rural village so you would of thought we would hear it but it was fine. It had a clean bed, shower and toilet what more do you want. We thought this hotel was fantastic for the price. People should pay more if they want luxury instead of a place to lay their head, and believe me I'm picky about where I will stay but I can not fault this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “basic room. clean but basic. staff disinterested in customers. noisy.”
Reviews.Author: chrissyb_10
Reviews.Content: this is a typical budget hotel. my friend wanted to leave her bag there at 11 am (check in is 2 pm.) they charged her £10 for this. the room was clean but very basic. you need to bring anything you need with you as they provide next to nothing in the room. tea coffee towels and a bar of soap. thats it. the staff on reception were unhelpful and disinterested in the customers. we asked for one extra pillow as there were only 3 pillows in the room and both of us needed 2 each, we were told there were no pillows in the hotel and that some more were being delivered tomorrow. unlikely as "tomorrow" was a sunday!also useless to us.. we were only staying one night. we also asked to borrow a hairdryer in the morning and were again told that one wasnt available despite adverts saying one could be borrowed from reception. on leaving we expressed our dissatifaction of the service. the reception desk clerk took my friends phone number saying that the manager would call her the next day..... i wonder if that will happen? the hotel was also pretty noisy about 2 ~ 3 am with some idiot running along our corridor and knocking on all the doors. i was with my friend but i would not choose to take my kids to this hotel. it was cheap and clean, but basic. i stayed in london victoria at the premier travel inn last year (again, fairly budget) and it couldnt have been more different ie pleasant friendly staff room with good facilities which proves that budget can be great. look at that one before booking travelodge tower bridge!

Reviews.Title: “The most uncomfortable room I have been in.”
Reviews.Author: TheChavez
Reviews.Content: I trusted the reviews from trip advisor, when we checked in I had to go downstairs and ask for another room because the first one smelled like smoke, the second one wasn't much better. You can hear the trains going by your window if you are on the second floor. This hotel is in the business district so do not expect any food to be served after 9 p.m. Staff was a hit a miss, some really friendly and helpful (one helped us to book a tour of London). The 2 other staff seemed to be forced to work there. I will not go back to this hotel for how much you pay it is not worth.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean and comfy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fiohna
Reviews.Content: We stayed 27 and 28 April on 5th floor which was fine on the roadside. Quite noisy with traffic yes, but no more than you'd expect. The bed was comfy and the bathroom facilities spotless. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful and on asking for extra pillows and a hairdrier these were provided with no fuss. Seeing that this was priced at about half of other London basic hotels and is 5 mins from tube station I think it's very good value and I'd much rather not pay for scented toiletries I don't really want. Have booked again for this weekend so will be able to see if it still seems as good!

Reviews.Title: “perfect for a cheap hotel in london”
Reviews.Author: Swalesy
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel expecting nothing special as it only cost us £30 a night pp. The room was basic but spotless and it even had a small flat screen tv!! we had a great nights sleep as it has quadruple glazing so we couldn't even hear the traffic outside, a definate triumph in london. overall this hotel is in a fantastic location ( a minutes walk from a central tube line) and above all else very cheap spotless rooms!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a short stay!!”
Reviews.Author: al-jh
Reviews.Content: Had an overnight stay on a quickly organised trip. Got a £29.00 deal. Hotel just around the corner from Tower of London & Tower Bridge and short walk to Tower Hill tube. Did not eat at hotel as Wetherspoons literally just across the road. Room was very clean and ideal for anyone on a short stay. Heard some noise from trains on line right at back of hotel but nothing to bother about. Check in and out very easy and staff friendly. Would definitely stay here again if back in London for a weekend trip.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap may not always be the best idea.!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: haggis1975
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this Hotel was the location, close to tower hill tube station, or tower gateway for the DLR. The room as you can imagine for a travelodge was basic to say the least, the rooms are tiny but adequatley decorated to an ok standard. reception is manned by people who seem more pre-occupied being in their little room than dealing with the paying guests, check-in was ok but be warned that if you arrive early and want to check-in it will cost you an extra tenner. Looking at the website for this hotel they offered a buffet breakfast for an extra £6.95 per person, great i thought how wrong was I. the choice was cereal a cooked breakfast which consisted of sausages, very cheap bacon, dry processed scrambled egg, cheap beans and a tomato. all presented in plastic tuppawear and, if you weren't there early enough a selection of two things ie beans and sausage, none of the staff seemed motivated enough to replace anything that wasn't there. Dont pay the price for this awful eating experience go accross the road to the weatherspoons and have a really good breakfast for half the price. £3.10 to be precise. All of our group experienced considerable noise from the hoards of hen nights and stag nights that seem to frequent this hotel not only when they were getting ready to go out ( which may I add I wasn't bothered by) but upon their return at 4/ 5 in the morning i wasn't pleased by. ( not a family friendly hotel) Please people don't be fooled by the price beacuse for an extra £30 you could stay in a luxury 4* hotel in knighsbridge, close to Harrods the natural history museum and the v&A (which was superb.) pay the extra cost it will be well worth it. In summary Hotel was grotty( toilets weren't cleaned for the 2 days I was there) the food was awful, the service laclustre. The only thing going for it was it's location and even that wouldn't enthrall me to ever stay in this hotel again. very very very poor. this ends my lesson in the travelodge gospel.

Reviews.Title: “Not so budget!”
Reviews.Author: onthewirral
Reviews.Content: After our flights to Vegas was cancelled due to the volcanic ashes we changed our plans to stay in London for 3 nights instead. This was very last minute and I did not have much time to look around, but the little time I did spend looking at hotels I was never too sure about location, value for money, cleanliness... We ended up booking the Travelodge, because I thought it was a name I could trust. I never stayed in one, so didnt know what to expect. First of all 250£ is not really what I call "budget". But I thought at least I would get everything I needed out of it. When we arrived i did look rather new and modern and a friendly lady checked us in immediately even though we were a little early. She proceeded with giving us one room key. I asked for a second, which she gave to us at no extra charge. Trying to get into our room, we were greeted by two confused spanish ladies, who clearly already occupied the room. So down we went and explained the situation and after asking us about 20 times "Are you sure?" she gives us a second room. This one was not occupied. It was good enough sized, hardly any furniture. There was nowhere to store our cloths so we had to leave them in our cases for the whole stay. The telly was a flatscreen mounted to the wall but was adjusted, so that it was hard to see a picture when lying on the bed. Our room was facing the station behind the hotel and as we were on the first floor, there was just a brick wall for a view. The windows only opened about 2inc for safety reasons, which was rather inconvenient as there was no fan in the bathroom and this 2inc gap was the only place where the steam could come out from after we took showers. The bathroom was very small. There was no bath, just a shower, no shampoo or anything like that was provided, but I was informed about that when I made the booking, so i remembered to bring some. We didnt eat in the restaurant area and while we were there we didnt see anyone eat there either. The prices were rather discusting at 7£ for breakfast each. We went to a pub on the other side of the bridge every morning which did full english breakfast for 1.99£. That is what I call great value! There was also a 5£ charge to use the internet in the hotel so we took our laptop with us to where we had breakfast as they had (like nearly every place these day) free WIFI. The good points about the hotel are deffinately cleanliness, location and comfort. It was very clean, with no signes of anyone occupying the room before us. The location was awesome! Right by the Tower bridge and the tower of London. The tube station was right around the corner and there was a tesco express there aswell. And the beds are soooo cumfy! The shower was brilliant! And we hardly heard any noise from the train station. I realy wished I had done more research before booking it, as I am sure I could have gotten just as much comfort for less. They didnt even have a hairdryer, telephone or a clock in the room! All things that I totally expected to be there. Maybe if I had booked it earlier I would not have had to pay quite so much, and at a lower price I would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SandN
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on an Easter break to London and were impressed by the cleanliness & new feel to the hotel. The location was great - the tubes were all out of action but there was a bus which went from more or less outside the hotel straight to Covent Garden, via the south bank, in about 25 mins and ran every 10 mins. Tower Hill is a lovely area to walk around too, lots of places to see & eat out. The hotel had a large bar/restaurant, which we didn't use, but it looked great and the prices were good. The hotel is also within a 15 min walk of Brick Lane where we walked for curry - a great experience! On the website it mentions that you might be disturbed by train noise, however this is just from very slow trains coming in & out of Fenchurch Street nearby so you can hardly hear them and they certainly wouldn't stop you from sleeping! All in all a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Real Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: JamesPlymouth
Reviews.Content: I booked 4 weeks before we stayed there and got a room for £52 a night which for a good sized ultra clean fully equiped and well maintained hotel room in London is amazing. Add on the hotels location, across the road from Tower Bridge and theTower of London and with in 100 meters on a tube station, the light railway station and bus stops jit just gets better.

Reviews.Title: “For a budget Hotel which is clean and friendly choose this one”
Reviews.Author: holidaysun_10
Reviews.Content: A very clean and friendly Hotel located just around the corner from Tower Hill underground. We stayed on the 3rd floor and the room was very clean, modern albeit small bathroom, tv, kettle with complimentary coffee/tea, the sheets and pillows were lovely and clean, we stayed on the side facing the railway and the noise from the train didn't bother me at all as the double glazing was sufficient to deaden the sound, the only noise which did disturb me on my first night's stay were other guests doors banging shut, by the second night we'd done so much in the day/night that by the time I went to bed I slept like a baby. We were quite far down the corridor and the only concern I would have if I stayed here again would be if I had a room adjacent to the entrance to that floor as you can only gain access to each floor with your own room key so each floor has an initial door you have to go through, I wouldn't fancy hearing that door opening and closing at least 60 times as each guests passes through, don't get me wrong the doors don't bang shut but you'd certainly hear it closing in the first couple of rooms on any given floor, at least I'd think so. For a budget Hotel I would certainly recommend this one, it's fairly new so although it's very basic, it's clean and modern. Not knowing London though I didn't realise that most of the Tower Hill area would be shut down on Saturday evening and after we'd been to see a show at Leicester Square we thought we'd head on back to be closer to our Hotel, thought we'd find a pub somewhere for a final drink of the evening, bit of a mistake as there didn't appear to be anywhere open, something to bear in mind if you're staying in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a night or two”
Reviews.Author: mayday2073
Reviews.Content: I had one evening at this hotel and must say it is a very good hotel for a city break. This was a second stay at Travelodge Tower Bridge. It's simple no frills. This time the bed was not to comfy, mattress a little too soft and could do with a change. Other than that everything was fine. We arrived late in the evening and checked in immediately. The only problem I have with this hotel is that prices can be a little steep for the basics that you get and no free breakfast. I thought Travelodge was a budget hotel. Anyways.... Just around the corner from Tower Hill tube station but make sure you exit the station nearest the Tower of London or you might be in for a very long walk on the other side. Cross the street , make a left and it's around the corner from the pub. A good base for a break in London.

Reviews.Title: “Anonymous and noisy but you get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: pinchoholic
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the day before an interview so accept that I may not have slept all that well anyway. However the sheets were thin and there was light and noise from the train line right outside my window. Having said that it was perfectly clean and the location could not have been better. Step outside and there is Tower Bridge. It's utterly charmless but it's also cheap! One big downside for me though is that you are not allowed to leave your luggage there during the day so I turned up to my interview hot and huffing dragging a big suitcase-not good!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, value for money with clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: alcmc
Reviews.Content: Great location very short stroll to Tower of London & Tower Bridge, very handy to Tower Hill tube, DLR, buses including tourist buses. More of a business area rather than a full on tourist hotel area. Interesting back streets to wander around in, near to some of the old markets etc. Lovely pub The Minories right next door doing great pub meals & handy cafes short walk away near the Tower for breakfast, so did not really eat at hotel. Only real downside was no air con in rooms and was a but stuffy at night as road noise a bit loud with window open, would not stop me staying again though. Clean and tidy, perfectly good place for the budget conscious to spend the night after a day out seeing the sights. Very cheap rates to be found booking each day on its own.

Reviews.Title: “great value hotel ....... recommened”
Reviews.Author: red104
Reviews.Content: |Stayed with my teenage son, for one night, only paid £19.00 and £4.00(ish) for the breakfast for us both as children free when booked on line at the time. The hotel was clean and basic and i would defo recommend it, for a cheap stay over whilst in the capital.... the breakfast was nice enough.... they do have a restuarant, for dinning at night time but we used the weatherspoons just down from the hotel. The location was great only a few mins from tower hill underground station....

Reviews.Title: “Bring Earplugs”
Reviews.Author: mikeyman67
Reviews.Content: For what you pay it has the bases covered. The hotel is clean. The rooms are spartan and the bed is passable. As many others have said its right between a main road and directly adjacent to a train line. The walls are thin and the floors squeek and groan. It is, however, a very short walk to tower bridge, the Tower of London and public transportation (Tower Hill station and Tower gateway are on the same block. Not bad for what I needed on this trip, but if on Holiday I would have stayed elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but expensvie”
Reviews.Author: smartalec1954
Reviews.Content: Single night stayed; booked late. I have used this chain before but never in London and was concerend to read that some rooms suffer noise from the railline immediately alongside the hotel. First sights of the Hotel is not good. Grey concrete alongside a 4 lane road one side, a busy rail/underground system the other. I managed to obtain a room roadside onthe 4th Floor. Very clean and modenrised interior. Souless place but functional. I paid £101 for one night to include a self service breakfast. It worked. The room was very small. One double bed with a soft mattress. TV on wall. Simple deskand that was it. THe room was heated by a wall heater that was very efficient. Be aware of summer. No air conditioning and this place was hot in winter with no heating! Bathroom was a shower and very small. Single sliver of soap. Food menu looked OK but my choice was simple rubbish. Overall a bit pricey but simple and clean within throwing distane of the Tower of London.

Reviews.Title: “Best Budget Hotel in London”
Reviews.Author: julie r
Reviews.Content: London can be a mare to find a decent hotel at a reasonable price but this travelodge at tower bridge is in our opinion the best hotel at a decent price that you'll ever find. Located just around the corner from tower hill tube on the district line your 15 minutes away from the west end at most.Aldgate east tube is a few mins walk in the other direction and Liverpool st is also a 10 min walk.The DLR also stops more or less next to the hotel with Tower gateway and Fenchurch St station is nearby. There are numerous bars/cafes dotted around Minories and for a late night drink Dirty Dicks at Liverpool st and Brick lane are 10-15 minutes stagger away or a fiver in a cab.
